name: Florence
slogan: An online marketplace for UK temporary nursing jobs
description:
Florence is a pioneering online platform that is taking a fresh and intelligent approach to managing the healthcare staffing crisis. Built with the needs of nurses and healthcare providers at the forefront, Florence is a marketplace that cuts out the middleman and empowers healthcare managers to find the right staff with the right skills at the right time. 

At Florence, we all have a definitive mission - to help people  receive the  level of care they deserve!  Our online marketplace helps care homes find and book temporary staff without the need for expensive recruitment agencies. Launched in 2017, we now work with over 20,000 nurses and carers and over 600 care home locations across England and Wales.  Nurses and carers have worked almost 500,000 hours and earned more than £8million by booking shifts through Florence.

team.name: Dan Blake
team.bioHtml: Founder, Investor, Board Member. Passionate about helping startups succeed

team.name: Charles Armitage
team.bioHtml: Co-founder and CEO of Florence | Doctor

team.title: Co-Founder & COO
team.name: Dan Blake
team.bioHtml: Founder, Investor, Board Member. Passionate about helping startups succeed

jobs.title: Social Media Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
At Florence, we all have a definitive mission - to dominate social care recruitment by the end of 2020. Our online marketplace helps care homes find and book temporary staff without the need for expensive recruitment agencies.

Launched in 2017, we now work with over 20,000 nurses and carers and over 600 care home locations across England and Wales. Nurses and carers have worked almost 500,000 hours and earned more than £8million by booking shifts through Florence.

We are a growing team of 50, founded and led by a former doctor-turned-entrepreneur. This is a really exciting time to join Florence and be part of a tech startup that is filled with collaborative, passionate and driven people.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR 
You will have a proven track record of demonstrating exceptional knowledge and understanding of the social media landscape – including content optimisation and publishing algorithms, building and engaging communities, social listening and reporting, planning and execution of social-led campaigns, and an understanding of the latest technologies impacting key platforms.

You are passionate about social, and understand the complexities and nuances because you are an avid user. You are naturally curious, always seeking out best practice examples, and aren't afraid to break down barriers by trying new ways of doing things.

You are a strategic thinker and are able to confidently interpret overall business goals, as well as specific marketing requirements, using social insights to develop specific social strategies and briefs.
You will be a confident communicator and be able to build working relationships well. Your attention to detail will be second to none, and it will help to ensure flawless execution of your social strategy.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
Strategy:
Underpinned by audience insight, establishing and owning the entire Florence social media strategy – it's yours to take from idea to execution to reporting
Own and develop the social media marketing roadmap, identifying key campaigns, conversations, partnerships and moments in the year to provide value, delight our users and make an impact
Devise and execute social responses and briefs from wider marketing strategies, working closely with other digital streams to ensure synergy and alignment with wider growth objectives

Publishing:
Plan and optimise the social content calendar, communicating with members of the wider business to keep on top of latest company news, as well as keeping on top of the relevant events in the social care sector
Plan logisitics around live capture and publishing across multiple platforms, and be able to live publish in a reactive and fast paced environments

Content:
Use a combination of data-led learnings, best practice and completely out-of-the-box ideas to create beautifully designed and well thought-out content campaigns that provides value to our prospective and existing users
Share content performance learnings and devise strategies and tactics to increase reach and engagement

Reporting & Insights:
Management and tracking of campaign performance and BAU activity against KPIs
Trends & Innovation:
Seeking out and proactively sharing trends and opportunities in the social and wider digital landscape

ABOUT YOU 
At least 2-3 years experience managing social campaigns across key channels – experience at a consumer-focused startup or agency is a bonus, but not imperative
A strategic and analytical thinker that can interpret numbers and data into actionable insights and learnings
Can demonstrate a strong work ethic and willingness to learn; enthusiastic, resourceful and imaginative are essential traits
A natural communicator online and offline – confident in presenting social campaigns and activities to different parts of the business
Has an ability to interpret, prioritise and deliver actions with a sharp attention to detail
Can work independently and under pressure, with the ability to be reactive and flexible in a fast-paced environment
Has an impeccable eye for great design and is comfortable working in Photoshop, Illustrator and/or Sketch to deliver creative that's engaging, relevant and on-brand
It would be great if you also have photography and videography skills to support the creation of content used in your campaigns, as well as supporting the wider marketing initiatives.
All in all, you are a positive and active person, who leans into every challenge, every campaign, every day. You’re positively disruptive, you constructively challenge, you're creative and willing to go the extra mile – and you don't mind a little bit of elbow grease.



BENEFITS
25 days holiday
Company contributory pension scheme
Regular company and social outings
Brand new Laptop and mobile supplied when joining
Finish early fridays
Opportunity to contribute to growth to an early stage startup
Fun, friendly and collaborative startup office environment
Friendly office dogs
